sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_62500_mealplan_recipe"> <x_62500_mealplan_recipe action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <cook_time/> <cooking_instructions>1. In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, and pepper. 2. Add chicken drumsticks to the marinade. Mix well. 3. Cover and marinate for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator. 4. Preheat oven to 400Â°F (200Â°C). 5. Place marinated chicken drumsticks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 6. Drizzle with olive oil. 7. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, until chicken is cooked through and charred at the edges. 8. Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.</cooking_instructions> <cuisine display_value="Indian">8f495a179791021069a3b6fce053afcf</cuisine> <diet/> <effort display_value="Moderate">bee0a76e9730021069a3b6fce053af3e</effort> <image/> <ingredients>Chicken Drumsticks (500g), Yogurt (1/2 c</ingredients> <meal_type display_value="Dinner">ca8516df9751021069a3b6fce053afdf</meal_type> <name>Tandoori Chicken</name> <nutrition>Calories: 300, Protein: 20g, Fat: 15g, Carbs: 10g</nutrition> <owned_by/> <pre_cook>false</pre_cook> <prep_instructions>1. Prepare marinade.</prep_instructions> <prep_required>false</prep_required> <prep_time/> <serving>2</serving> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_created_on> <sys_id>f091d71f9795021069a3b6fce053afdc</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-04-07 01:22:04</sys_updated_on> <time_of_day/> </x_62500_mealplan_recipe> </record_update>
